result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Information filed with the Court. DE waives further reading of the Information. Defendant pleas NG. Court confirms address and phone number. Court adjourned at 2:38 pm.

2:31 PM Jeremy Eugene Ealy in Court,  Atty Travis Satorius appeared in court, ADA Joseph M. Schieffer appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 22CF126, 22CF134, 22CF181 (PH). Atty Satorius: all PH will be a waiver. Court reviews and questions DE. Court finds DE freely, intelligently and knowingly waives constitutional right to a preliminary hearing. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DE probably committed a felony. Court binds DE over for further proceedings.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 28, 2022 at 11:30 am.

records.addlTxt: 1:58 PM Defendant Jeremy Eugene Ealy appears in Court, ADA Joseph M. Schieffer appears for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 22CF136, 22CF134 (PH) and 22CM136 (STC). ADA Schieffer called the Officer off today. Court questions DE on counsel, he now does qualify for PD. DE states he will be going into a rehabilitation program tomorrow. Waive the time limits. Court finds DE freely, intelligently and knowingly waives constitutional right to a PH on 22CF126 & 22CF134. ADA Schieffer would like to set the PH in 45 days or so. Court confirms address and phone number. Court adjourned at 2:09 pm.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Preliminary hearing on July 18, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
DE from PCJ
Bond conditions are read to defendant.  PO Box 242, Hager City, WI 54014 mailing address. Court confirms DOB.  352-400-9056 phone.  Set for prelim on 7/18/22 at 2:30 p.m.

03:12 PM Defendant Jeremy Eugene Ealy in court, in custody.  Joseph M. Schieffer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jeremy Eugene Ealy appeared by video means.  Katelynn Dippolito appears via phonewith defendant.    Defendant has copy of complaint.  Defendant waives further reading.   Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and constitutional rights.  Defendant understands charges, penalties and constitutional rights.  ADA Scheiffer requests cash bond in the  amount of $500.00 conditions of absolute sobriety, no entry to bars, taverns or liquor stores.  Defendant addresses court regarding possible living situation.  Defendant object to cash bond, requests signature bond. ADA Schieffer's bond request remains the same.  Court orders $5,000 signature bond with conditions of absolute sobriety and not to enter an business establishment which for primary services sells or serves alcohol..  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 02:30 pm. Adjourned at 3:30 p.m.
